result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED. Fine paid in full. Remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
APPLY BAIL. DNA Paid in Full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donte L Miller

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

09:56 AM Defendant Donte L Miller in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 16CM933 dismissed and read in to this matter.  Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by Defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $ 316.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Cash bail from this matter  and from 16CM933 to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.

01:35 PM Defendant Donte L Miller in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests bail be reinstated and makes statements.  State has no objection.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Hearing on April 12, 2019 at 09:30 am.

01:25 PM Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court, defendant Donte L Miller not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court attempted to contact defendant by video but was unsuccessful.  Attorney Kershek states defendant has a plea/sentencing hearing in Milwaukee County today at 1:30 PM.  Attorney Kershek requests a status date to be set.  Court notes this is the fourth time defendant has not been made available by video.  Court will set the matter before the Trial Court.  Attorney Kershek notes depending what happens at defendants plea/sentencing date, the defendant could potentially be at a prison facility.  DEFENDANT TO APPEAR BY VIDEO FROM MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL FOR NEXT APPEARANCE.  Hearing scheduled for April 12, 2019 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court, defendant Donte L Miller not in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced in time for the video appearance set for 3:15 PM.  Court waited until 3:26 PM but had to call the matter as another video appearance is set for 3:30 PM.  Attorney Kershek states there is a competency evaluation being done in Milwaukee County and there is a return on doctors report date soon.  Attorney Kershek is requesting a new date in January and for the defendant to appear by video.  Court will adjourn and defendant to appear by video from Milwaukee County Jail.  Warrant remains active.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 17, 2019 at 03:15 pm.
